result.execSummary:
The defendant Ibn I. Wallace was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Ibn I. Wallace is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Ibn I. Wallace was found guilty of Manufacture/Deliver Heroin (<3g), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(d)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
3:35 p.m. Defendant Ibn I. Wallace in court with attorney Richard J. Shawl.  Michael W. Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Also calling 13CF29.  Counsel in receipt of revocation summary. Schiek statement to sentencing. Shawl statement to sentencing/speaks to revocation summary; requests return of cell phone & lift no contact with K.V. State objects to both requests. Wallace statement. Bloom statement to sentencing. Court advises defense to file motion with regards to return of phone.

Court Sentence - consecutive to Milwauke Case 07CF82
13CF29
WSP - 30 mos. (18 mos. initial confinement/12 mos. ES)
393 days' credit
CC/Supervision
AODA treatment as ordered by agent
Eligible for earned release program & CIP
DNA surcharge
Voting Rights/WEDS given
Appeal Rights

14CF19 consecutive to 13CF29
WSP 60 mos. (18 mos. initial confinement/42 mos. ES)
CC/Supervision
Eligible for earned release program & CIP
DNA surcharge
Voting Rights/WEDS given
Appeal Rights
Sentencing hearing on April 9, 2014 at 03:30 pm.

03:52 pm - Defendant Ibn I. Wallace in court with attorney Richard J. Shawl.  Defendant Ibn I. Wallace in custody.  Michael W. Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Schiek states an offer has been made; however there are two other cases pending (Oneida/Milwaukee).  Shawl states the other Oneida County Case is a revocation sentencing.  Shawl requests entering plea on today's date.  State moves to amend Count 1 - Striking the enhancer and dismissing count 2 - Granted.  Defendant pleads no contest.  Plea questionnaire filed.    Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty.  Court will remove jury trial from calandar keep for status.  Bail continued.
States Reply to Discovery  and State's Demand for Discovery

10:44 am - Defendant Ibn I. Wallace in court with attorney Richard J Shawl.  Defendant Ibn I. Wallace in custody.  Michael W Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives preliminary hearing. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that probable cause exists and binds over.  Schiek states Information will mirror criminal complaint - Shawl would like to proceed w/arraignment and enters not giutly pleas on behalf of defendant.  Defendant orally requests speedy trial demand.  Shawl statement to modify bond.  Court takes under advisement - will stay decision pending outcome of hearing scheduled this afternoon.  Bail continued.  Jury trial scheduled for May 7, 2014 at 08:30 am.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 1, 2014 at 03:30 pm.

01:58 pm - Defendant Ibn I. Wallace in court, via video,  with attorney Richard J Shawl.  Defendant Ibn I. Wallace in custody.  Michael W Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  In receipt of complaint, waive reading -set for preliminary hearing - Bail continued.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 14, 2014 at 10:30 am. - Defendant addresses court concerning the no contact provision of bond.  Would like to have contact w/K.V.
no contact w/Kirstie Voss (co-defendant)

02:36 pm - Defendant Ibn I. Wallace in court, via video, in custody.  Michael W Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint to be faxed to jail, right to counsel - defendant states spoke with PD and was found to be eligible,  Schiek statement to bail - Court sets $ cash bond.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for February 6, 2014 at 01:15 pm.
